DOCNAME: CASE OF KACHERSKAYA AND FROLOVA v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Volodymyr Butkevych;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE ; the second applicant was born in DATE . They live in GPE , GPE region , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the first applicant CARDINAL NORP hryvnas ( ORG ) in salary arrears against ORG department for education .
CARDINAL . On DATE the same court awarded the first applicant ORG CARDINAL in compensation for recreation leave allowance against the same defendant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the second applicant ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL in salary arrears against ORG department for education . On DATE , the same court awarded the second applicant ORG CARDINAL in compensation for recreation leave allowance against the same defendant .

CARDINAL . In DATE , the ORG informed the applicants that the judgments in their favour could not be enforced due to lack of the funds in the ORG budget , and the property of the debtor could not be attached since it was a public institution .
CARDINAL . The judgments given in favour of the applicants remain unenforced .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgments of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
